perturbation.original_text: Section 1.2 Integrity agrees to use its best efforts to solicit orders for the sale of the Shares at the public offering price, as determined in accordance with the Registration Statement, and will undertake such advertising and promotion as it believes is reasonable in connection with such solicitation. Integrity shall order Shares from the Fund only to the extent that it shall have received purchase orders therefore.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 1.2 Integrity agrees to use reasonable efforts to solicit orders for the sale of the Shares at a price it deems fit. Integrity may undertake advertising and promotion as it believes is beneficial in connection with such solicitation. Integrity shall endeavor to order Shares from the Fund, but this is subject to market conditions and the availability of Shares.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity in the definition of 'solicit orders' and 'order Shares'. 'Best efforts' is replaced with 'reasonable efforts,' reducing the obligation. 'Public offering price' is replaced with 'price it deems fit' . The mandatory 'shall' is softened to 'endeavor,' making the ordering of shares discretionary.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 1.8 Integrity will bear all expenses in connection with the performance of its services and the incurring of distribution expenses under this Agreement. For purposes of this Agreement, “distribution expenses” of Integrity shall mean all expenses borne by Integrity or by any other person with which Integrity has an agreement approved by the Fund, which expenses represent payment for activities primarily intended to result in the sale of Shares, including, but not limited to, the following:
(a) payments made to, and expenses of, persons who provide support services in connection with the distribution of Shares, including, but not limited to, office space and equipment, telephone facilities, answering routine inquiries regarding the Fund, processing shareholder transactions, and providing any other shareholder services;
(b) costs relating to the formulation and implementation of marketing and promotional activities, including, but not limited to, direct mail promotions and television, radio, newspaper, magazine, and other mass media advertising;
(c) costs of printing and distributing prospectuses and reports of the Fund to prospective shareholders of the Fund;
(d) costs involved in preparing, printing, and distributing sales literature pertaining to the Fund;
(e) costs involved in obtaining whatever information, analyses, and reports with respect to marketing and promotional activities that the Fund may, from time to time, deem advisable; and
2
Source: INTEGRITY FUNDS, 485BPOS, 1/21/2020

(f) sales commissions and other fees paid, together with related financing costs to brokers, dealers or other selling entities with a
dealer agreement in effect for the sale of Fund Shares.
Distribution expenses, however, shall not include any expenditures in connection with services which Integrity, any of its affiliates,
or any other person has agreed to bear without reimbursement.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 1.8 Integrity will bear some expenses in connection with the performance of its services and the incurring of certain distribution expenses under this Agreement, as mutually agreed upon by Integrity and the Fund. For purposes of this Agreement, “distribution expenses” of Integrity may include expenses borne by Integrity or by any other person with which Integrity has an agreement approved by the Fund, which expenses represent payment for activities intended to generally support the distribution of Shares, and may encompass:
(a) payments made to, and expenses of, persons who provide general support services relating to the distribution of Shares, including potentially office space and equipment, telephone facilities, and vaguely answering inquiries regarding the Fund;
(b) costs relating to the potential formulation and implementation of marketing and promotional activities, maybe including direct mail promotions and limited television, radio, newspaper, magazine, and possibly other mass media advertising;
(c) a portion of the costs of printing and distributing prospectuses and reports of the Fund to possible shareholders of the Fund;
(d) costs involved in very minimal preparation, printing, and distribution of sales literature pertaining to the Fund;
(e) costs involved in occasionally obtaining some information, minimal analyses, and brief reports with respect to some marketing and promotional activities that the Fund may, from time to time, suggest; and
2
Source: INTEGRITY FUNDS, 485BPOS, 1/21/2020

(f) some sales commissions and vague other fees possibly paid, together with vaguely related financing costs to possibly brokers, dealers or other selling entities with a dealer agreement in effect for the sale of Fund Shares.
Distribution expenses, however, may include certain expenditures in connection with services which Integrity, any of its affiliates,
or any other person has agreed to bear without reimbursement.
perturbation.explanation: This change significantly reduces the obligation on Integrity to bear distribution expenses. 'All expenses' is changed to 'some expenses', introducing uncertainty. 'Shall mean' is weakened to 'may include', making the included items optional. The specific examples are also weakened with 'potentially', 'vaguely', 'possibly' and 'some', making the scope of distribution expenses unclear and subject to interpretation.

perturbation.original_text: Section 4.1 The Fund authorizes Integrity and any dealers with whom Integrity has entered into dealer agreements to use any prospectus or statement of additional information furnished by the Fund from time to time in connection with the sale of Shares. The Fund agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold Integrity, its several officers and governors, and any person who controls Integrity within the meaning of Section 15 of the 1933 Act, free and harmless from and against any and all claims, demands, liabilities, and expenses (including the cost of investigating or defending such claims, demands, or liabilities and any counsel fees incurred in connection therewith) which Integrity, its officers and governors, or any such controlling person may incur under the 1933 Act, the 1940 Act, or common law or otherwise, arising out of or based upon any untrue statement or alleged untrue statement of a material fact contained in any registration statement, any prospectus, or any statement of additional information, or arising out of or based upon any omission or alleged omission to state a material fact required to be stated in any registration statement, any prospectus, or any statement of additional information, or necessary to make the statements in any of them not misleading;
perturbation.changed_text: Section 4.1 The Fund authorizes Integrity and any dealers with whom Integrity has entered into dealer agreements to use the prospectus or statement of additional information currently furnished by the Fund in connection with the sale of Shares. The Fund agrees to potentially indemnify, possibly defend, and vaguely hold Integrity, its officers and governors, and any person who controls Integrity within the meaning of Section 15 of the 1933 Act, vaguely free and somewhat harmless from some claims, demands, liabilities, and potential expenses (maybe including the cost of investigating or defending such claims, demands, or liabilities and some counsel fees potentially incurred in connection therewith) which Integrity, its officers and governors, or any such controlling person may incur under the 1933 Act, the 1940 Act, or somewhat under common law, if related to claims arising out of an untrue statement of a fact contained in a registration statement, prospectus, or statement of additional information, or arising out of omission to state a fact required to be stated in such documents, or necessary to make the statements in any of them not misleading.
perturbation.explanation: The changes introduce uncertainty by weakening the obligation and scope of indemnification. 'Agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold' is changed to 'agrees to potentially indemnify, possibly defend, and vaguely hold,' making the obligation discretionary. 'Any and all claims' is reduced to 'some claims', 'Expenses' are now 'potential expenses' and additional qualifiers are inserted throughout the text further reducing the level of obligations and reducing its binding nature.
